greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: a(1) = 1; for n>1, a(n) = n/(largest Fermi-Dirac factor of n).
comment: For n > 1, a(n) = the smallest positive number d such that n/d is a "Fermi-Dirac prime", a term of A050376.
link: Antti Karttunen, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..65537
mathematica: f[p_, e_] := p^(2^Floor[Log2[e]]); a[n_] := n / Max @@ f @@@ FactorInteger[n]; Array[a, 100] (* _Amiram Eldar_, Nov 26 2020 *)
results.author: _Antti Karttunen_, Apr 13 2018
